thread.title: Law Firms Take Shears to Debt Loads
thread.title_full: Law Firms Take Shears to Debt Loads

title: Law Firms Take Shears to Debt Loads
text:
Law Firms Take Shears to Debt Loads Dewey’s collapse prompts others to trim reliance on bank loans By Updated July 19, 2015 7:56 p.m. ET 
Debt is beginning to spook the legal industry. 
In the years since Dewey & LeBoeuf LLP’s collapse, law firms have cut their reliance on bank loans and leaned more heavily on their partners for cash in times of need. 
The change isn’t solely a reaction to Dewey’s high-profile flameout in May 2012, but some law-firm leaders say watching... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
